<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Turrets

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Moves the soldier into the vehicle's turret. (Immediately, without animation). ''turret path'' is an array of positions inside a turret, or positions inside a turret of a turret.
<br>
<br>[0] means first turret.
<br>[1] means second turret.
<br>[0,0] means first turret of first turret.
<br>[0,1] means second turret of first turret.
<br>[1,0] means first turret of the second turret.
<br>And so on.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> unitName '''moveInTurret''' [vehicle, turretPath]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> turretPath: [[Array]] - see Description.

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne '''moveInTurret''' [_tank, [0, 0]] </code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allTurrets]], [[fullCrew]], [[assignAsTurret]], [[moveInAny]], [[moveInCargo]], [[moveInCommander]], [[moveInDriver]], [[moveInGunner]], [[assignAsCargo]], [[assignAsCommander]], [[assignAsDriver]], [[assignAsGunner]], [[ArmA:_Actions#GetInTurret|GetInTurret]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 6, 2008</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]</dt>
<dd class="note">To find out which turrets are available on a vehicle, and what the syntax is, you can use [http://kronzky.info/turrets/index.htm this little script].</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 13, 2014</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:hcpookie|hcpookie]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Examples for nested turrets:

MainTurret = <code>_soldierOne '''moveInTurret''' [_tank, [0]] </code>

CommanderTurret = <code>_soldierOne '''moveInTurret''' [_tank, [0, 0]] </code>

... where:

MainTurret is the standard BIS MainTurret... e.g:
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang="cpp"</attr><inner>
class Turrets 
{
	class MainTurret {};
};
</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>

CommanderTurret is the standard BIS CommanderTurret located on the MainTurret... e.g:
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang="cpp"</attr><inner>
class Turrets 
{
	class MainTurret
	{
		class Turrets 
		{
			class CommanderTurret {};
		};
	};
};
</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 18, 2014</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Here is a small function to find available ''turret paths'' for a given vehicle. It will only search 2 levels deep, hence called ''commonTurrets'':
<code>KK_fnc_commonTurrets = {
	[[private]] ["_arr","_trts"];
	_arr = [];
	_trts = [[configFile]] / "CfgVehicles" / [[typeOf]] _this / "Turrets";
	[[for]] "_i" [[from]] 0 [[to]] [[count]] _trts - 1 [[do]] {
		_arr [[set]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[count]] _arr, [_i]];
		[[for]] "_j" [[from]] 0 [[to]] [[count]] (
			_trts / [[configName]] (_trts [[select]] _i) / "Turrets"
		) - 1 [[do]] {
			_arr [[set]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[count]] _arr, [_i, _j]];
		};
	};
	_arr
};</code>
Example call:
<code>[[hint]] [[str]] ([[vehicle]] [[player]] [[call]] KK_fnc_commonTurrets); //[[0],[0,0]]</code>
See also [[allTurrets]]
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
